intro: Microcoelia koehleri, commonly known as the Koehler's microcoelia, is a unique member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
